title: 2 Simple Ways to Clear Your Facebook Cache on an iPhone

steps.title: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad.
steps.content: Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. Facebook is available for iOS in the App Store . This method alone only deletes your browsing data from within the Facebook app, not all data stored in the Facebook app. The only way to delete all cached Facebook data is to delete the app .

steps.title: Tap Menu ☰ in the bottom-right corner.
steps.content: Tap Menu ☰ in the bottom-right corner. This will open the menu.

steps.title: Tap Settings & Privacy.
steps.content: Tap Settings & Privacy . This will be next to a cog icon. Alternatively, you can tap the cogwheel icon at the top right of the menu.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Browser.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Browser . You can find this under the "Preferences" heading, and it has an icon of a web browser.

steps.title: Tap Clear.
steps.content: Tap Clear . This is the grey button next to "Cookies and cache." This will delete the browsing data associated with the Facebook app. Alternatively, you can get to this menu when you have a link open in the Facebook app by tapping the three-dot menu in the upper-right corner, then by tapping Go to Settings . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap and hold the Facebook app on your Home screen.
steps.content: Tap and hold the Facebook app on your Home screen. This is the white f with a blue background. To fully clear the Facebook cache on iPhone and iPad, you'll need to uninstall and reinstall the app. This will not delete your Facebook photos , but you will be required to log back in. Be sure to have your login information ready.

steps.title: Tap Remove App.
steps.content: Tap Remove App . This is the last link at the bottom of the menu. If Facebook is not on your Home screen, you can delete it from your App Library. Swipe left until you've reached your list of apps, tap and hold Facebook , and select Delete App > Delete . [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Delete App to confirm.
steps.content: Tap Delete App to confirm. The Facebook app will be deleted.

steps.title: Restart your phone.
steps.content: Restart your phone. You must restart your phone after deleting the Facebook app to fully remove it and its cache from your device. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Open the App Store .
steps.content: Open the App Store . You'll need to reinstall the Facebook app.

steps.title: Go to the Facebook app page.
steps.content: Go to the Facebook app page. You can do this by entering Facebook into the search bar and tapping the app. You can also tap your profile picture in the top-right corner, tap Purchased , then find Facebook in the list of apps. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the download icon.
steps.content: Tap the download icon. This looks like a cloud with a down-arrow. If you’ve installed Facebook before, you'll see the cloud icon. If this is your first time downloading an app, you will see Get . The app will begin downloading to your iPhone.

steps.title: Tap Open.
steps.content: Tap Open . If you left the app store, you can tap the Facebook app on your home screen to open it.

steps.title: Enter your login details to sign in.
steps.content: Enter your login details to sign in. Use your phone number or email and your password to login to your Facebook account. If needed, you can reset a forgotten password or create a new account . [5] X Research source Your Facebook cache is now cleared. If your iPhone is still running slow, consider freeing up space by deleting unused apps and optimizing iCloud storage. [6] X Research source

steps.title: What is the Facebook cache?
steps.content: What is the Facebook cache? A cache is temporary data that has been saved by an app or website. The cache makes the app/website load faster during subsequent visits, because the data doesn't have to be downloaded each time you use it.

steps.title: What does clearing the cache do?
steps.content: What does clearing the cache do? Clearing the cache removes the temporary data. Sometimes, the cache data becomes corrupt or unstable, and can cause issues. Clearing out the cache will fix that.

steps.title: How often should I clear my Facebook cache?
steps.content: How often should I clear my Facebook cache? You should only clear the Facebook cache if you're experiencing issues with the Facebook app. While clearing the cache isn't harmful, it's a good idea to keep your cache intact to make the Facebook app faster and smoother.

steps.title: Is it a good idea to clear my Facebook cache?
steps.content: Is it a good idea to clear my Facebook cache? If your Facebook app isn't cooperating, clearing the cache is a good idea. It's a quick and simple way to troubleshoot the app.
